title: [BUG] BATS/TBATS In-sample error
body:
**Describe the bug**
Get reference error when insample predictions are done for BATS and TBATS.

**To Reproduce**
See [code gist here](https://gist.github.com/ngupta23/32856ac7116179fbfe95cea3c1e9ad25)

```python


/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/_base.py:220: FutureWarning: return_pred_int in predict() will be deprecated;please use predict_interval() instead to generate prediction intervals.
  FutureWarning,

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
UnboundLocalError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-12-0d389f978f91> in <module>()
      1 import numpy as np
----> 2 forecaster.predict(fh=-np.arange(0, len(y)), return_pred_int=True)

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/_base.py in predict(self, fh, X, return_pred_int, alpha, keep_old_return_type)
    227                     X=X_inner,
    228                     return_pred_int=return_pred_int,
--> 229                     alpha=alpha,
    230                 )
    231 

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/base/adapters/_tbats.py in _predict(self, fh, X, return_pred_int, alpha)
    136 
    137         if return_pred_int:
--> 138             return y_pred, pred_int
    139         else:
    140             return y_pred

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'pred_int' referenced before assignment


```

**Expected behavior**
Out of sample works ok. Only insample seems to be an issue.

**Versions**

sktime = 0.8.1
